introduction.title: Introduction
introduction.content: TradeCalc is a smart entry price calculator tool that helps traders manage risk effectively. The application calculates position size based on account balance, desired risk level, and stop loss price.

setup.title: Initial Setup
setup.content: When using for the first time, you need to set up your name and account balance. This information will be stored locally on your device.

usage.title: How to Use
usage.description: After setup, you'll see the main calculation screen:

risk.title: Risk Level (%)
risk.description: % of account balance you're willing to lose if order hits SL
risk.example: Account 1000 USDT, risk 2% = willing to lose 20 USDT

leverage.title: Leverage (x)
leverage.example: 10x = can trade with 10 times the amount

stopLoss.title: SL (%)
stopLoss.description: % price can move against you before cutting losses
stopLoss.example: SL 2% = if price drops 2%, automatically cut losses

slCalculation.title: Calculate SL% from actual prices
slCalculation.description: Instead of entering SL%, you can calculate from specific Entry and SL prices:
steps: SL% will be automatically calculated and filled in

positionReduction.title: Reduce Position Size
positionReduction.description: After calculation, you can reduce position if it feels too large:
steps: Or click 'Custom' and enter desired % reduction

settings.title: Settings
settings.access: Click the ‚öôÔ∏è icon in the top right corner
options: Account Balance: Update when there are changes
Default Risk Level: Default value when opening app
settings.tip: Set appropriate default values to avoid entering them repeatedly

tips.title: Effective Usage Tips
dos: Don't risk more than 2-5% of account per trade
donts: Don't use excessive leverage without experience
Don't ignore stop loss due to emotions

positionTooLarge.question: Position size too large?
positionTooLarge.answer: Reduce risk % or increase SL %. Or use position reduction feature.

positionTooSmall.question: Position size too small?
positionTooSmall.answer: Increase risk % (within safe limits) or decrease SL %.

dataLoss.question: Lost settings data?
dataLoss.answer: Data is stored in browser. Avoid clearing cache or using incognito mode.

dataSafety.question: Is data safe?
dataSafety.answer: Completely safe. All data is stored only on your device, not sent to servers.

conclusion.title: Happy Trading!
conclusion.message: Discipline and risk management are more important than profit. Stay safe! üìö‚ú®
